name: Rubicon 1997
description: ‘Upcoming ‘97, from extended ripening season in cooler year, closed-in nose but intense berry/black cherry concentration in palate; dense, latticed, dry tannins finish with extraordinary length. No obviously cheery fruit here. Arresting  extraction suggests this deserved keeping a minimum of 7 years, preferably longer. Such density needs forbearance and will bring its rewards. On par with ‘95, ‘91 and greats of the 80’s.’ - Platter’s SA Wine Guide 2001, 4.5☆ The wines will continue to be cellared at the Meerlust vintage cellar until maturity (estimated 2028) or withdrawal. Rubicon is not produced every year. If a vintage is not produced, the NFT will include the next vintage, to total 50 consecutive vintages
